title: Bug 6410: File appears to be unchanged but is marked as dirty by code assist
description: When using code assist, the file appears to be unchanged visually, but it is marked as dirty by the IDE.
OB: After invoking code assist (CtrlSpace) on a Java file with the cursor inside a leftmost parenthesis of a method call, the file is marked as dirty.
EB: After invoking code assist (CtrlSpace) on a Java file with the cursor inside a leftmost parenthesis of a method call, the file should not be marked as dirty unless there are actual changes made.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor in the following line: 
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press CtrlSpace to invoke code assist.
5. Observe that the file is marked as dirty even though there are no actual changes made.
